title: Demo Episode: Bible Soap Opera
subtitle: Learn the whole Bible. Find Jesus in every story.
summary: This episode contains the pilot audio drama with accompanying discussion questions.

slides.content: Hello. Welcome to this drama lesson. Today we are going to learn about Abraham and how he trusted God's word.

Remember when God asked Abraham to sacrifice his son Isaac? Read it now in Genesis 22.

Click when you're ready.

slides.question: Why do you think God asked Abraham to sacrifice Isaac?

answers.value: <small>To check Abraham - perhaps he had disobeyed God</small>
<small>To show Abraham what God was like, and teach him about resurrection</small>

slides.content:
Paul is in trouble again - what will he do?

Answer these questions to find out.

slides.question: What did Paul’s uncle give him as a gift?

answers.feedback: Yes, Paul's uncle gave him a TV
No, Paul's uncle didn't give him a phone
No, Paul's uncle didn't gave him a football

slides.question: What does Paul’s uncle want Paul to do with the TV now?

answers.feedback: No, Paul's uncle doesn't want him to keep the TV
Yes, Paul's uncle does want him to give it back

slides.content: How does Paul feel about this? Discuss in your group now.
Paul feels confused. He thought his uncle was kind, but now he’s not sure. He also feels ashamed. His neighbours will laugh at him if he gives back the TV.

slides.question: Who said this: Abraham must have done something wrong, and so God is taking away the promises by taking away Isaac.

answers.feedback: Hmm. You need to make a clearer decision. Was it David or Samson? Please try again.
Sorry, David didn't say that, Samson did.

slides.question: Who said this: 'Abraham learnt about resurrection. So even if Abraham died without the promises coming true in his lifetime, Abraham wouldn’t miss out on any'?

answers.feedback: Sorry, Samson didn't say that, David did.
Hmm. You need to make a clearer decision. Was it David or Samson? Please try again.

slides.question: Who would you listen to if you were Paul?

answers.feedback: Hmm. Will Samson's advice turn out to be the best?
Hmm. It can be hard to choose.
Hmm. Will David's advice turn out to be the best?

slides.question:
David said to Paul: 'You know, many years later, another loved son was obedient, and offered himself as a sacrifice. But this son was provided by God. And he came back from death.'
Who is the son that offers himself?

slides.content: Jesus is the lamb that God provides. God loves Jesus, his only son. Jesus was obedient to his Father, and trusted Him with his life. Jesus is the perfect sacrifice that takes away our sin. God raised Jesus up from death. He will raise us also when we trust in Jesus.

Well, that’s a happy ending. Paul decided to trust his uncle. His uncle was always being kind, even when Paul didn’t understand his words. We learnt that Abraham learnt to trust God – even beyond death. How about you? When do you find it hard to trust God’s Word? You can talk about this with your group now.

We hope you enjoyed this demo episode.

Written by Martin Olmos and Joe Radkovic.

Acting by Samuel Gates, Ruth Lee, Luke Forster, and Harry Martin.

This project aims to help christians with an oral culture learn how the whole Bible fits together, with Jesus at its heart. Follow this project at biblesoapopera.com
